thread.title: Alex Ovechkin lifts Capitals past Canucks, 3-2
thread.title_full: Alex Ovechkin lifts Capitals past Canucks, 3-2

title: Alex Ovechkin lifts Capitals past Canucks, 3-2
text:
Alex Ovechkin lifts Capitals past Canucks, 3-2 The Washington Capitals beat the Vancouver Canucks 3-2 on Thursday night for their fourth straight victory. Post to Facebook Alex Ovechkin lifts Capitals past Canucks, 3-2 The Washington Capitals beat the Vancouver Canucks 3-2 on Thursday night for their fourth straight victory.  //on.wusa9.com/1S0aZ6p   Join the Conversation To   Alex Ovechkin lifts Capitals past Canucks, 3-2 Associated Press, AP 1:11 a.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Oct 22, 2015; Vancouver, British Columbia, CAN; Washington Capitals forward Alex Ovechkin (8) scores against Vancouver Canucks goaltender Ryan Miller (30) during the third period at Rogers Arena. The Washington Capitals won 3-2. Mandatory Credit: Anne-Marie Sorvin-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Anne-Marie Sorvin, Anne-Marie Sorvin-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
VANCOUVER, British Columbia (AP) - Alex Ovechkin broke a tie with 4:55 left and the Washington Capitals beat the Vancouver Canucks 3-2 on Thursday night for their fourth straight victory. 
Jay Beagle pulled Washington even at 5:42 of the third, and Ovechkin won it with his fifth goal of the season - all in the past five games. 
Jason Chimera scored in the first for the Capitals, but Radim Vrbata and Henrik Sedin each had a goal and an assist in the second for Vancouver. 
Washington's Braden Holtby made 23 saves. He stopped Daniel Sedin on a 2-on-1 midway through the third, and made a save against Bo Horvat with less than 7 minutes left. 
Washington is 5-1-0 and has beaten Chicago, Carolina and Calgary on its streak. 
Vancouver lost its third straight, including a 2-1 overtime loss to Edmonton last time out, to fall to 3-2-2. CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE
